page.title: 05Kennethmont: Agriculture
page.content: Livestock reared in this area is mainly limited to beef cattle and sheep,although some dairy cattle and pigs are also kept.The beef cattle are mainly Aberdeen Angus,Hereford and Charolais, while Cheviot, Suffolk and Scottish Blackface are the most commonly kept breeds of sheep.Most farmers keep poultry for their own or local use.Barley and grass are the most common crops,some barley is sold but most is kept to feed stock, the grass being cut as hay or silage.Some oil-seed rape is grown for sale as is a small amount of wheat although our climate does not really suit wheat growing. Swedes are grown as winter feed for sheep and cattle and quite a lot of potatoes are grown and sold locally. Some farmers also keep a few hives of bees.
